meanings.definition: One of the cells formed by the division of a mesoblast in the development of an embryo.
meanings.sent1: During embryo growth, mesomeres play a crucial role in cell division.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the mesomeres to understand how the cells develop in embryos.
meanings.sent3: The mesomeres in the embryo seemed to be having a tiny party, dividing and multiplying.
meanings.sent4: The mesomeres were like tiny building blocks, coming together to form the intricate structure of the embryo.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the mesomeres looked like busy workers constructing the embryo.

meanings.definition: A segment of the body of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The mesomeres of the earthworm's body help in its movement.
meanings.sent2: Each mesomere in the caterpillar's body serves a specific function.
meanings.sent3: The mesomeres in the frog's body decided to have a race to see who could move the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The mesomeres along the snake's body resembled colorful beads on a necklace.
meanings.sent5: The mesomeres in the fish's body shimmered like tiny jewels under the water.
